result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Latrell J. Hill

records.addlTxt:
9;38 AM Prosecuting attorney Daniel Joseph Tombasco in court for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant Latrell J. Hill in court, in custody.  Attorney Michael Robert Barth in court for Latrell J. Hill. Clerk N. Nobile.
MINUTES: Victim rights compliance. Attorney Barth is requesting an adjournment to discuss a global offer for all the DE's cases, including the ones in Branch 4. The State does not object. The Court does not object to Branch 4 hearing all the DE's cases for sentencing, but also does not object to all the DE's cases being heard in Branch 6. Court will adjourn.
Final pre-trial scheduled for November 21, 2022 at 10:30 am.
Notice of assignment of judge returned. Return to sender. No such number. Unable to forward.

State appears by Attorney Alexander Huber. Attorney Michael Robert Barth in court with Defendant Latrell J. Hill who appears in custody.  Clerk: PU
  Minutes:   DE has no conflict with proceeding before Judge Gabrele today. Atty Barth states he is trying to reach a global resolution and requests an adjournment; no objection by the State.  Final pre-trial scheduled for September 22, 2022 at 09:30 am.

records.addlTxt: Br 3 notified of RFS and Sched order

Defendant Latrell J. Hill appeared with Attorney Michael Robert Barth.  Defendant in custody. Attorney Daniel Alejandro Bernard Deida appeared for the Prosecution.  Clerk JT  Minutes:  DE waives preliminary hearing; probable cause found.  Case bound over.    DE requests substitution of Br 3; Br 4 assigned. Information filed, reading waived.  Not guilty plea entered.  Bond continued.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for July 22, 2022 at 09:30 am.
DE requests substitution of Br 3; Br 4 assigned.

Preliminary hearing scheduled for July 8, 2022 at 08:45 am.
